This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=BMVA.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-04T09:37:38Z R Bowden 2015-03-04T09:37:25+00:00 2015-03-04T09:37:25+00:00 BMVA: CFP BMVC15 - 26TH BRITISH MACHINE VISION CONFERENCE https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMVA;7b030201.1503 26TH BRITISH MACHINE VISION CONFERENCE<br>7-10 September 2015, Swansea, UK<br>http://bmvc2015.swan.ac.uk<br>(CALL FOR PAPERS)<br><br>The British Machine Vision Conference (BMVC) is one of the major international conferences on computer vision and related areas. It is organised by the British Machine Vision Association (BMVA).<br><br>The 26th BMVC will be held at Swansea University Singleton Campus, 7th-10th September 2015. The University Singleton Campus is set in a rolling parkland overlooking the majestic sweep of Swansea Bay, the start of the famously dramatic Gower coastline comprised of twenty-one bays and coves. The network is endorsed by both the British Machine Vision Association (BMVA) and the Applied Vision Association (AVA) - the major computer and biological vision research bodies in the UK.<br>Second workshop Wednesday 1st July 2015 - Thursday 2nd July 2015. Bailbrook House Hotel, Bath, Somerset.<br>Invited speakers<br>James Elder, York, Canada<br>2 others to be confirmed.<br>Call for Participation<br>We invite all academics and relevant industrial practitioners interested in the fostering of human and computer vision research to the second annual meeting [...] R Bowden 2015-02-17T09:19:52+00:00 2015-02-17T09:19:52+00:00 BMVA: Computer Vision Summer School 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMVA;a70d0e0c.1502 BMVA Computer Vision Summer School 2015<br>6 - 10 July, Swansea University, UK<br>http://cvss.swansea.ac.uk<br><br>1 intensive week of training\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd20 years of BMVA tradition<br>British Machine Vision Association (BMVA) runs an annual Computer Vision Summer School aimed at PhD students in their first year, though it will be beneficial to other researchers at an early stage in their careers. Despite the title, students from non-UK universities are welcome to attend, as well as students from UK universities. Places are limited to ensure good interaction in lab classes. A key reason that such applications have not yet emerged is simply that the robust and real-time perception of the complex everyday world that they require has simply been too [...] R Bowden 2015-01-23T14:28:59+00:00 2015-01-23T14:28:59+00:00 BMVA: BIS mapping event https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMVA;92022fcf.1501 Dear members<br><br>Many of you may have already received an email from UK Gov about their crowd sourced tool to map out the UK research landscape.<br>The BMVA would like to encourage all its members to submit entries to reinforce the importance of research areas relevant to our membership e.g. Computer vision, image processing, machine learning and the various subareas of interest.
